title: Which book describes the history of Sri Lanka right? - Quora

response.answer_text: It varies according to the time period that you're interested in. There aren't many English books about the pre colonizes Ceylon. But starting from late 1500s, there are documented reports to be found. Although most of their accuracy is doubtful, the books written by the British governors and civil servants are accurate to a certain extent. Try the following authors...-Robert Knox-John Doyle-Leonard Wolfe-R.L. Spittle-David ebbelIf you want the genuine Sri Lankan history, try finding a translation of the book "MAHAWANSAYA" (good luck with that). Also, Sri Lankan's modern history (after the independence) is only recorded in a political manner. All governing and civil war and stuff. If you want to read them try the following.-Gota's war-...?- A drop from the history- Rohitha munasinghe.-Divided island - Samantha Subramanian Other types of books- wave- sonali deraniyagala(tsunami)-Chinamen - shehan karunatilake(cricket)
